Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery closed vessel, probably a hydria; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of part of head and upper body of draped woman to right, possibly wearing an earring, necklace with small pendant in dilute brown; she wears a sleeved chiton with five black buttons running down sleeve, and holds the kolpos of her chiton between her teeth; at left, left hand of second figure. Preliminary sketch.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Naukratis (Bought by Hogarth at Naukratis)
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding a woman holding the kolpos of her chiton between her teeth while tying her belt, see Agora XXX, pl. 65, no. 603.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0114) (Phase 1)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr David George Hogarth
